subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Norse Afterlife: Valhalla, Hel, and Everything Between
description: Learn The Norse Afterlife: Valhalla, Hel, and Everything Between in one minute.

hook.text: Die in battle: Valhalla. Die in bed: Hel. Norse afterlife was sorted by how you died, not how you lived.

buildup.text: Valhalla was Odin's great hall where warriors feasted and fought. Hel was a cold, gray realm for everyone else.

discovery.text: Valkyries chose the worthy dead from battlefields and carried them to Valhalla. Even death required being selected.

twist.text: There was no moral judgment. Good people who died peacefully went to Hel. Vikings valued courage over kindness.

climax.text: Norse afterlife valued action over virtue. It was a warrior religion: you were defined by how you faced death.

punchline.text: Valhalla rewarded courage, not goodness. Die fighting and feast forever.

quiz.question: What determined where you went in the Norse afterlife?
